intro: Stimoryne saxicola, commonly known as the rock stimoryne, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually small and white or pale pink, often clustered in inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
